abstract: Dubai will ask creditors of two of its flagship firms for a standstill on debt worth billions of dollars as a first step toward restructuring Dubai World, the conglomerate that spearheaded the emirate’s breakneck growth.
snippet: Dubai will ask creditors of two of its flagship firms for a standstill on debt worth billions of dollars as a first step toward restructuring Dubai World, the conglomerate that spearheaded the emirate’s breakneck growth.
lead_paragraph: Update | 5:31 p.m. The New York Times’s Landon Thomas Jr. has more details on Dubai’s restructuring efforts here.

headline.main: Dubai World Asks for Time to Reorganize Debts
